Detailed Description

Interface class providing methods to connect to networks or hardware interfaces and to enable data transfer. The implementation is network dependent and MUST be done in derived classes specific to the platform.

Definition at line 65 of file linkinterface.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RODOS::Linkinterface::Linkinterface ( long  linkId) [inline]

Constructor.

Parameters:
linkIdUnique identifier for the link within this node. 0 is reserved for local broadcast messages, any other value will do. Used to determine from which link a message was received.

virtual bool RODOS::Linkinterface::getNetworkMsg ( NetworkMessage &  inMsg,
int32_t &  numberOfReceivedBytes 
) [inline, virtual]

Processs all received Data. When a NetworkMessage is complete it returns true

Parameters:
inMsgNetworkMessage to write to. When return false this may contain incomplete Data, so do not touch it
numberOfReceivedBytesWhen return=true this contains the number of Bytes really received or -1 if it is unknown. Should be ==Networkmessage.numberOfBytesToSend() in case of no error.

Reimplemented in RODOS::LinkinterfaceCAN, RODOS::LinkinterfaceUART, and RODOS::LinkinterfaceUDP.

Definition at line 104 of file linkinterface.h.

virtual void RODOS::Linkinterface::init ( void  ) [inline, virtual]

To initialize the hardware and to establish physical interfaces. Depending on the type of interface set interrupt handlers (UART) or select a port (UDP) and init the local node number if possible.

Reimplemented in RODOS::LinkinterfaceCAN, RODOS::LinkinterfaceUART, and RODOS::LinkinterfaceUDP.

Definition at line 95 of file linkinterface.h.

virtual bool RODOS::Linkinterface::isNetworkMsgSent ( ) [inline, virtual]

Returns if all buffered Messages have been transmittet on the wire. If this returns true the next call to sendNetworkMsg should immetiatly start sending out the new messages.

Reimplemented in RODOS::LinkinterfaceUART.

Definition at line 111 of file linkinterface.h.

virtual bool RODOS::Linkinterface::sendNetworkMsg ( NetworkMessage &  outgoingMessage) [inline, virtual]

Sends NetworkMessage over the Link. May block. When it returns the Message should be send out or have been buffered.

Parameters:
TheMessage to send

Reimplemented in RODOS::LinkinterfaceCAN, RODOS::LinkinterfaceUART, and RODOS::LinkinterfaceUDP.

Definition at line 117 of file linkinterface.h.

void RODOS::Linkinterface::setThreadToResume ( Thread *  thread) [inline]

This Thread is resumed when there is new Data availible and getNetworkMsg should be called or when buffered Messages have been transmittet on the wire.
